entry.title: All the quiet places
entry.summary:
Author: sageevreeen

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,796Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 6

Summary: New walls, old ghosts. Buck is trying to settle into a house that once felt like home, but the silence that follows him is heavier than the boxes he’s unpacking. A fight left words unsaid and distance that keeps stretching. He tells himself he’s fine, that distractions are enough. But some nights are quieter than others—and some silences cut deeper than they should.

entry.title: Fallout
entry.summary:
Author: fortnight_lillies

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,087Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 1

Summary: Ever since the accident the only thing Buck gets up for has been the familiar sound of Eddie knocking on his door, and the bright faced boy that accompanies his father. Carla had been away for a week now, taking care of a sick family member, so in the meantime Buck was stepping in. Buck knows that realistically it doesn’t help with the pain. When his leg feels as if it’s collapsing in on itself or when the pain medication seems to just slip through without even an attempt at aid. When the pain gets so bad that he doesn’t know how to keep going. He knows that in those moments having Eddie and Chris around doesn’t actually reduce the pain or makes it go away. But boy does it feel like it.__When a ballistic missile heads towards L.A Buck has to fight through the pain sustained from being crushed under a fire engine, in order to stay alive and save his loved ones, whilst also having to deal with a sexuality crisis.

entry.title: The Ghost of You
entry.summary:
Author: bvddiesbro

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,272Chapters: 8/20Kudos: 544

Summary: Evan "Buck" Buckley thought he had left his past behind when he traded his Navy fatigues for turnouts. For years, he’s buried the memories—of war zones, of a lost lover, of the life he swore he'd never return to. But when a series of arson attacks target classified SCIF sites across Los Angeles, his past comes back to haunt him.NCIS are called to investigate and Buck’s carefully constructed web of lies begins to crack when Special Agent Sam Hanna arrives at Station 118—because Buck knows him. Sam was once his teammate, his mentor and his sudden reappearance is no coincidence.When a grainy surveillance video reveals a face Buck thought he’d never see again, the ground shifts beneath his feet. Zack, the man he mourned, the man he watched die, is alive.Working alongside NCIS and his old SEAL Team, Buck finds himself walking a dangerous tightrope. The deeper he gets, the more he risks everything—his job, his family, his friendships and the life he’s built with Eddie and Christopher.But secrets can’t stay buried forever.

entry.title: I’m feeling like I’ve missed you all this time
entry.summary:
Author: Chimneys118

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,427Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 15

Summary: “Fuck it. Fine. But you’re calling Cap and thinking of a reason good enough to explain why neither of us can come in!” Buck declared, settling back into the bed while Eddie snuggled back into his chest. It was hard to say no when things felt so perfect.“Easy. I came home last night, bringing food from some pizza truck on the way. We both came down with an awful case of food poisoning, it's been a rough night. At least one part of that is true.” Eddie decided, giggling, he was enjoying this too much. Or Buck and Eddie finally realise they are in love with each other. As they try to navigate their relationship, more and more lies get told to keep it a secret. Unfortunately, hiding a new relationship from those who know them best proves to be more difficult than expected.

entry.title: hey, feverer
entry.summary:
Author: trysetmeonfire

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,629Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 67

Summary: There are protocols to follow after calls like this so Bobby follows them as quickly as he can and then goes to find Buck. He checks the bunk room and the lounge upstairs, but only cursorily. Hen had made eye contact with him over Buck’s shoulder as she’d said “Let’s get some air,” her hand gently on his arm and Chimney on his other side. The roof, then. He grabs a water bottle from the kitchen on the way there, a granola bar. Something in your stomach. Can’t fix everything, but. Whatever. Can’t hurt.—Bobby comforts Buck after a call gone wrong
